intro: Prunella dissecta, commonly known as narrowleaf selfheal, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern United States and southeastern Canada. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant features slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves that are deeply lobed and have a serrated edge. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, arranged in dense whorls along the stems. Prunella dissecta is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
